segments.text: I see the woman standing in the water, and it’s like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she’s just standing there, drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be exhausted or something, to not notice all this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the water splashing onto the floor, but she doesn’t react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is going to fall, and she won’t even turn around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to look up from that dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is a disaster, and she’s just standing there, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she seems, even with water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to regret not paying attention when it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
